instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on charger but not booting.
threads.message:
Fairly clean board, had a tiny amount of corrosion around <RESISTOR>R7101</RESISTOR> but nothing major.

Mac came in booting up but customer said it would some times shutdown, it booted about 3 times then it shutdown and it no longer boots up.

I get 0.8V on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> for about 10 seconds, CPU heats up a bit then Mac shuts down again, I can repeat that if I unplug and re-plug the charger, this is the same case with or without battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on charger but not booting.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on charger but not booting.
threads.message: Yes we did the revive option and passed all the way but same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on charger but not booting.
threads.message:
Test the board disconnecting all the cables.
Keep only charger; try also connecting the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on charger but not booting.
threads.message: Charger alone, same thing, charger and battery I see the charger going up to 2A but nothing changes, I left the charger on for a while to see if it made a difference later on but nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on charger but not booting.
threads.message:
Check if all components surrounding <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> are good.
Also check solders and traces.
Test removing <CAPACITOR>C7101</CAPACITOR>.
May need to change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> even...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on charger but not booting.
threads.message:
Removed <CAPACITOR>C7101</CAPACITOR> same thing, checked the resistors and caps around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> all OK and last I replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and nothing changed.

Ended up restoring T2 completely but same thing, at no point I have USB activity, however the trackpad does click.

Any last suggestions will be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on charger but not booting.
threads.message:
Trackpad click is not life sign.
Force feedback appears once actuators get power.

Tried known good battery for sure?
Does it charge its original battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on charger but not booting.
threads.message:
Yes battery is good, in fact I used this case to test another MBP that had bad battery and it worked here fine.

I can see the charger take almost 2A when the battery is connected and board remains cool, when charger is disconnected ppbus is 11.4V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on charger but not booting.
